org.gwtbootstrap3.client.ui.base

Class AbstractTooltip

  • Object
    • AbstractTooltip
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AcceptsOneWidget, HasOneWidget, HasWidgets, IsWidget, Iterable<Widget>, HasHover, HasId
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Popover, Tooltip

    public abstract class AbstractTooltip
extends Object
implements IsWidget, HasWidgets, HasOneWidget, HasId, HasHover
    Common implementation for the Bootstrap tooltip and popover.
    Author:
    Joshua Godi, Pontus Enmark, Steven Jardine

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface HasWidgets

        HasWidgets.ForIsWidget

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractTooltip(String dataTarget)
      Creates the empty Tooltip
      AbstractTooltip(String dataTarget, String title)

      AbstractTooltip(String dataTarget, Widget w)
      Creates the tooltip around this widget
      AbstractTooltip(String dataTarget, Widget w, String title)
      Creates the tooltip around this widget with given title

      • prepareTemplate

        protected String prepareTemplate()

      • reconfigure

        public void reconfigure()
        Deprecated. will be removed after the next release.
        Reconfigures the tooltip.

      • recreate

        public void recreate()
        Recreate the tooltip/popover with a default dealy of 300ms between the call to destroy and init.

      • recreate

        public void recreate(int delay)
        Recreate the tooltip/popover. The delay is necessary because the destroy of the tooltip needs to be complete prior to calling init.
        Parameters:
        delay - the delay in ms between the call to destroy and init.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Widget w)
        Specified by:
        remove in interface HasWidgets

      • setAlternateTemplate

        public void setAlternateTemplate(String alternateTemplate)
        Set the alternate template used to render the tooltip. The template should contain divs with classes 'tooltip', 'tooltip-inner', and 'tooltip-arrow'. If an alternate template is configured, the 'tooltipClassNames', 'tooltipArrowClassNames', and 'tooltipInnerClassNames' properties are not used.
        Parameters:
        alternateTemplate - the alternate template used to render the tooltip

      • setContainer

        public void setContainer(String container)
        Sets the custom container that the hover's HTML will render in
        Specified by:
        setContainer in interface HasHover
        Parameters:
        container - String selector of where to render the hover's HTML code

      • updateTitleWhenShowing

        protected abstract void updateTitleWhenShowing()
        Update the title. This should only be called when the title is already showing. It causes a small flicker but updates the title immediately.
